page.title: 08PARTRIDGE GREEN RECREATION
page.content: THE PARK known as ST.GEORGE'S FIELD,is used for it's many facilities and is greatly appreciated by the community.It has SPORTS facilities:tennis,cricket and football,and a playground for children.It has a lot of WILDLIFE including black spotted woodpeckers and a variety of lizards.Bats have been seen at night by many people including GARETH WHITE of CLASS 5 who saw one following another in May 1985.The WOOD surrounding the park has many old oak trees.People go walking in the park with their dogs.It also houses the SCOUT HUT,outside of which the boys light fires and roast sausages in the summer.
